title: Psalm 139 Memorization
description: I memorized this Psalm for a class assignment in theology. This was originally given on December 10th, 2021.

transcript_parts.text: to do
[Music]
the memorization thing too and i as well
decided to do a psalm mine's only one
song though
um i picked this psalm in psalm 139 for
a couple of reasons one is that
when i was reading through it i felt
that this is something that we often
quote but we don't have the whole thing
in our heads and the whole argument i
guess if you want to call it that that
the psalmist is making it's also a very
interesting psalm as you'll see when i
recite it because it's basically saying
where are you god and then the psalmist
tells himself well i know where god is
and he's right here next to me
but i think this is what we do all the
time in our own lives and it goes right
to the point of you know what israel
means in hebrew to struggle with god and
this is really a struggling and the
other interesting thing about it is one
of the things that we learned when we
were reading about the psalms this year
is that when the psalms say of david it
doesn't necessarily mean that david
wrote the psalm sometimes it could be
sometimes it's not most of the time it's
actually not it means i was written
probably during the reign of david
and it's in all likelihood this psalm
would have been sung
communally and so this is a communal
struggle that we all go through and so i
thought it was a very interesting
passage and it's just
i mean all the songs are beautiful but
this one really i guess
caught my attention in some important
ways so i memorized it in the english
standard version and this is psalm 139.
oh lord you have searched me and know me
you know when i sit down and when i rise
up you discern my thoughts from afar you
search out my path am i lying down and
are acquainted with all my ways
even before a word is on my tongue
behold o lord you know it all together
you hem me in behind and before you lay
your hand upon me
such knowledge is too wonderful for me
it is high
i cannot attain it
where shall i go from your spirit or
where shall i flee from your presence
if i send you to the heavens you are
there if i make my bed in shoal you are
there if i take the wings of the morning
and dwell in the uttermost parts of the
sea
even there your hand shall lead me and
your right hand shall hold me
you you for you formed my inward or no
sorry
even if i should say surely the darkness
shall cover me and the light about me be
night
even the darkness is not dark to you
the light is his brightest day for
darkness is this light with you
for you formed my inward parts you
knitted me together in my mother's womb
i'll praise you for i'm fearfully and
wonderfully made
wonderful all your work so god my soul
knows it very well
my frame was not hidden from you when i
was being made in secret
intricately woven in the depths of the
earth your eyes saw my unformed
substance and your book were written
every one of them the days that were
formed for me when as yet there were
none of them
how precious to me are your thoughts o
god how vast is the sum of them
if i could count them they are more than
the sand
i awake and i'm still with you
oh that you would slay the wicked o god
o men of blood depart from me
they speak against you with malicious
intent
your enemies take your name in vain
do i not hate those who hate you and do
i not load those who rise up against you
i hate them with complete hatred i count
them
my enemies
search me o god and know my heart try me
you know my thoughts and see if there be
any grievous way in me and lead me in
the way of everlasting
thank you
